tachyon.worker

Class DataServerMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • tachyon.worker.DataServerMessage

  • public final class DataServerMessage
extends Object
    The message type used to send data request and response for remote data.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkReady()
      Checks if the message is ready.
      void close()
      Closes the message.
      static DataServerMessage createBlockRequestMessage()
      Creates a default block request message, just allocates the message header, and no attribute is set.
      static DataServerMessage createBlockRequestMessage(long blockId)
      Creates a block request message for an entire block by the block id, and the message is ready to be sent.
      static DataServerMessage createBlockRequestMessage(long blockId, long offset, long len)
      Creates a block request message for a part of the block by the block id, the offset and the length.
      static DataServerMessage createBlockResponseMessage(boolean toSend, long blockId, ByteBuffer data)
      Creates a block response message specified by the block's id.
      static DataServerMessage createBlockResponseMessage(boolean toSend, long blockId, long offset, long len, ByteBuffer data)
      Creates a block response message specified by the block's id, the offset and the length.

      Returns whether the message finishes sending or not.

      Gets the read only buffer of the message's data.

    • Method Detail

      • createBlockRequestMessage

        public static DataServerMessage createBlockRequestMessage()
        Creates a default block request message, just allocates the message header, and no attribute is set. The message is not ready to be sent.
        Returns:
        the created block request message

      • createBlockRequestMessage

        public static DataServerMessage createBlockRequestMessage(long blockId)
        Creates a block request message for an entire block by the block id, and the message is ready to be sent.
        Parameters:
        blockId - The id of the block
        Returns:
        The created block request message

      • createBlockRequestMessage

        public static DataServerMessage createBlockRequestMessage(long blockId,
                                          long offset,
                                          long len)
        Creates a block request message for a part of the block by the block id, the offset and the length. The message is ready to be sent. If len is -1, it means requesting the data from offset to the end of the block.
        Parameters:
        blockId - The id of the block
        offset - The requested data's offset in the block
        len - The length of the requested data. If it's -1, it means request the data from offset to the block's end.
        Returns:
        The created block request message

      • createBlockResponseMessage

        public static DataServerMessage createBlockResponseMessage(boolean toSend,
                                           long blockId,
                                           ByteBuffer data)
        Creates a block response message specified by the block's id. If toSend is true, it will prepare the data to be sent, otherwise the message is used to receive data.
        Parameters:
        toSend - If true the message is to send the data, otherwise it's used to receive data.
        blockId - The id of the block
        data - The data of the message
        Returns:
        The created block response message

      • createBlockResponseMessage

        public static DataServerMessage createBlockResponseMessage(boolean toSend,
                                           long blockId,
                                           long offset,
                                           long len,
                                           ByteBuffer data)
        Creates a block response message specified by the block's id, the offset and the length. If toSend is true, it will prepare the data to be sent, otherwise the message is used to receive data. If len is -1, it means response the data from offset to the block's end.
        Parameters:
        toSend - If true the message is to send the data, otherwise it's used to receive data
        blockId - The id of the block
        offset - The responded data's offset in the block
        len - The length of the responded data. If it's -1, it means respond the data from offset to the block's end.
        data - The data of the message
        Returns:
        The created block response message

      • checkReady

        public void checkReady()
        Checks if the message is ready. If not ready, it will throw a runtime exception.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the message.

      • finishSending

        public boolean finishSending()
        Returns whether the message finishes sending or not. It will check if the message is a send message, so don't call this on a recv message.
        Returns:
        true if the message finishes sending, false otherwise

      • getBlockId

        public long getBlockId()
        Gets the id of the block. Make sure the message is ready before calling this method.
        Returns:
        The id of the block

      • getLength

        public long getLength()
        Gets the length of the message's requested or responded data. Make sure the message is ready before calling this method.
        Returns:
        The length of the message's requested or responded data

      • getLockId

        public long getLockId()
        Gets the id of the block's locker.
        Returns:
        The id of the block's locker

      • getOffset

        public long getOffset()
        Gets the offset of the message's data in the block. Make sure the message is ready before calling this method.
        Returns:
        The offset of the message's data in the block

      • getStatus

        public RPCResponse.Status getStatus()
        Gets the status of the response. Make sure the message is ready before calling this method.
        Returns:
        The RPCResponse.Status of the response

      • getReadOnlyData

        public ByteBuffer getReadOnlyData()
        Gets the read only buffer of the message's data. Make sure the message is ready before calling this method.
        Returns:
        The read only buffer of the message's data

      • isMessageReady

        public boolean isMessageReady()
        Returns:
        true if the message is ready, false otherwise

      • recv

        public int recv(SocketChannel socketChannel)
         throws IOException
        Use this message to receive from the specified socket channel. Make sure this is a recv message and the message type is matched.
        Parameters:
        socketChannel - The socket channel to receive from
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read, possibly zero, or -1 if the channel has reached end-of-stream
        Throws:
        IOException

      • send

        public void send(SocketChannel socketChannel)
          throws IOException
        Sends this message to the specified socket channel. Make sure this is a send message.
        Parameters:
        socketChannel - The socket channel to send to
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setLockId

        public void setLockId(long lockId)
        Sets the id of the block's locker.
        Parameters:
        lockId - The id of the block's locker
